text:
facebook 3.5k SHARES 
Miss Universe, actress, model, producer - the birthday girl, Lara Dutta, has worn many hats within the span of an almost two-decade long career. Her journey in the limelight started when she won the annual Gladrags Megamodel India competition in 1995. From then till now, she has been able to stay relevant to her fans by the virtue of being a confident, spunky, and sassy badass! 
She was born to a Punjabi father and an Anglo-Indian mother in Ghaziabad, Uttar Pradesh on April 16, 1978. She was three-years-old when her family moved to Bangalore. Thanks to her upbringing, Dutta is fluent in English, Hindi, Punjabi, as well as Kannada. 
After securing the first place at the Miss Intercontinental Pageant in 1997, she went on to win the crown of Femina Miss India Universe in 2000. At the Miss Universe Pageant in 2000, Dutta received the highest individual score in the history of the contest because her final interview blew the judges' minds! She scored a 9.99; something no else had achieved before. She also won the crown; the second Indian to do so ever. The same year Priyanka Chopra won the Miss World title and Dia Mirza won the Miss Asia Pacific one. 
Soon after it was announced in 2001 that Dutta has been appointed as the UNFPA Goodwill Ambassador working on issue mainly related to gender sensitivity and the HIV-AIDS crisis in Asia and Sub-Saharan Africa. 
Lara then made her Bollywood debut in 2003 with the film Andaaz , where she co-starred with Priyanka Chopra and Akshay Kumar. She won the Filmfare Award for Best Female Debut for her role. 
The year 2011, saw several new milestones in her life - both personal and professional. She tied the knot with celebrated tennis player Mahesh Bhupathi on February 16, and on August 1 she announced the news of her pregnancy. If her adorable Instagram posts with her daughter Saira, who was born on January 2012, are anything to go by, she seems like a super-fun mom. A post shared by Lara Dutta Bhupathi (@larabhupathi) on Jan 4, 2017 at 3:59am PST A post shared by Lara Dutta Bhupathi (@larabhupathi) on Oct 26, 2016 at 11:50am PDT 
On the work front, her first film as a producer, Chalo Dilli was release on April 29, 2011. The film starring Vinay Pathak, Akshay Kumar, and Lara herself received positive reviews from critics. She has started working on her second production as well. 
But, that's not all! Apart from her Bollywood career and social work, Lara also happens to be a trained classical dancer, avid sports enthusiast, and yoga and fitness freak. Is there anything this wonder woman can't do? 
Thank you for being the fun, spunky, sassy inspiration in our millennial Bollywood hearts, Lara! Happy Birthday!
title: Happy Birthday, Lara Dutta! Here’s A Look At This Wonder Woman’s Journey In Bollywood And Life, So Far
